javassist.build
Interface IClassTransformer

public interface IClassTransformer

A common interface to define class transformers, java (or groovy) entities that can manipulate classes during build processes, right after javac compiled them.

Author:
SNI

Method Summary
 void applyTransformations(javassist.CtClass ctClass)
          Concrete implementations must implement all transformations on this method.
 boolean shouldTransform(javassist.CtClass ctClass)
          Test if the given class is suitable for applying transformations or not.
 

Method Detail

applyTransformations

void applyTransformations(javassist.CtClass ctClass)
                          throws JavassistBuildException

Concrete implementations must implement all transformations on this method. You can use Javassist API to add/remove/replace methods, attributes and more. Only classes approved by shouldTransform(CtClass) are considered.

Parameters:
classToTransform - The class to transform.
Throws:
JavassistBuildException - if any error occur during the transformation.
See Also:
#filter(CtClass)

shouldTransform

boolean shouldTransform(javassist.CtClass ctClass)
                        throws JavassistBuildException

Test if the given class is suitable for applying transformations or not.

For example, if the class is a specific type:

 CtClass myInterface = ClassPool.getDefault().get(MyInterface.class.getName());
 return candidateClass.subtypeOf(myInterface);
Override this method to boost class transformations and discard classes you don't want to transform.

Parameters:
candidateClass -
Returns:
true if the Class should be transformed; false otherwise.
Throws:
JavassistBuildException - if any error occur during filtering.
